data.text: @LouisPeitzman What’s weird about this one is that someone I’ve followed for a while, who’s def not a resistance account, posted it today.

@LouisPeitzman @debenham I can't tell if it's borrowed from FB as an engagement tactic but it does remind me of pages on Facebook that ask pointedly STUPID questions framed in a challenging way, knowing that people will take the bait and boost them in the algorithm.
@debenham Yeah, there are a seemingly infinite number of resistance accounts who have tactics like this to boost followers. Not sure what the end game is?
@LouisPeitzman I also don’t understand why I keep seeing this same question from multiple people in my feed. Is engagement that important to people without personal brands?

@LouisPeitzman @joereid Oh, I thought it was them doubting that vaccines work at at all, so people are saying “yes” to show that they do (of course the nuance of being triple vaxxed and getting it but possibly milder and that this isn’t the point of public health is totally lost)
@OliviaMesser As someone who got COVID late and is stressed out by Pac-Man, I do understand the feeling.
@joereid The original tweet makes no sense—it's just designed to promote engagement. It's an ostensibly liberal account but the tweet sounds antivax.
@LouisPeitzman Because we feel like we are the last little bites in Ms Packman and need to feel solidarity about it
@LouisPeitzman I’m not sure what the implication is either way?
